page.title: 07SOCIAL..CONCERNS/CHANGES
page.content: With many farms now becoming mainly arable, trading patterns have altered to accomodate these changes. For example, corn exchanges have closed, stock is sold deadweight, there is direct dealing with merchants offices and warehouses and national companies are replacing local merchandising companies. These changes will have an effect on the social gatherings and so social circles between farmers and local people will collapse. With the much reduced rural population, this has brought about in effect a social change with Collessie primary school closing in 1981, post offices shutting and the local church now being linked up with the Howe of Fife church. Public services to the local farms improved with the introduction of electricity in 1952 and mains water in 1953.
